Tom Hardy is coming back to CBeebies. 
He last appeared on Bedtime Stories on New Year's Eve and his appearance went down a treat with little ones and mums alike. 
Much to the delight of parents across the country, the star is now returning to BBC studios for part two. 
Here's everything you need to know... What will Tom will be reading and when? Tom Hardy is coming back to CBeebies (Photo: CBeebies) 
The delicious Tom Hardy will be making his highly-anticipated return on Tuesday - aka Valentine's Day. 
According to the BBC website, the star will read The Cloudspotter by Tom McLaughlin. 
It tells the tale of Franklin and his adventure with a new pal in a hot-air balloon. Why has Tom signed up for Bedtime Stories? BBC bosses were desperate to bring the star back following the success of his first appearance on the show (Photo: Facebook/CBeebies) 
BBC bosses were desperate to get the Hollywood star back into the studio after the success of his last stint on the show. 
And it looks like their persuasive powers worked - but why did Tom agree? 
Well, off-screen, he and his wife Charlotte Riley are the proud parents of two young children. 
Somehow, we have a feeling the little one played a part in Tom's decision to jump into the world of children's TV a second time. What did Tom read last time? Tom will will read The Cloudspotter by Tom McLaughlin (Photo: CBeebies) 
Tom melted hearts across the country when he last appeared on CBeebies for a New Year's Ever special. 
Joined by his pet dog Woodstock, the actor read You Must Bring a Hat by Simon Philip and Kate Hindley. 
Smitten mums across the country went into meltdown on Twitter afterwards. Which other celebrities have taken part in Bedtime Stories? Kimberley Walsh has previously appeared on the show 
Tom isn't the first famous face to graces CBeebies. 
Previous celebrities that have taken part include Kimberly Walsh, Kym Marsh, Isla FIsher and Shobna Gulati. 
*CBeebies Bedtime Stories is on CBeebies every day at 6.50pm Like us on Facebook
